com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j

Class JsonRpcBasicServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jsonrpc4j.JsonRpcBasicServer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonRpcServer

    public class JsonRpcBasicServer
extends java.lang.Object
    A JSON-RPC request server reads JSON-RPC requests from an input stream and writes responses to an output stream. Can even run on Android system.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonRpcBasicServer(java.lang.Object handler)
      Creates the server with a default ObjectMapper delegating all calls to the given handler.
      JsonRpcBasicServer(java.lang.Object handler, java.lang.Class<?> remoteInterface)
      Creates the server with a default ObjectMapper delegating all calls to the given handler Object but only methods available on the remoteInterface.
      JsonRpcBasicServer(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper, java.lang.Object handler)
      Creates the server with the given ObjectMapper delegating all calls to the given handler.
      JsonRpcBasicServer(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper, java.lang.Object handler, java.lang.Class<?> remoteInterface)
      Creates the server with the given ObjectMapper delegating all calls to the given handler Object but only methods available on the remoteInterface.

      Sets the ConvertedParameterTransformer instance that can be used to mutate the deserialized arguments passed to the service method during invocation.

      Sets the ErrorResolver used for resolving errors.

      Sets whether or not the server should re-throw exceptions.
      void setShouldLogInvocationErrors(boolean shouldLogInvocationErrors)
      If true, then when errors arise in the invocation of JSON-RPC services, the error will be logged together with the underlying stack trace.

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestInterceptor

        public RequestInterceptor getRequestInterceptor()

      • setRequestInterceptor

        public void setRequestInterceptor(RequestInterceptor requestInterceptor)

      • handleRequest

        public int handleRequest(java.io.InputStream input,
                         java.io.OutputStream output)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles a single request from the given InputStream, that is to say that a single JsonNode is read from the stream and treated as a JSON-RPC request. All responses are written to the given OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        input - the InputStream
        output - the OutputStream
        Returns:
        the error code, or 0 if none
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error

      • getHandlerInterfaces

        protected java.lang.Class<?>[] getHandlerInterfaces(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Returns the handler's class or interfaces. The variable serviceName is ignored in this class.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - the optional name of a service
        Returns:
        the class

      • handleJsonNodeRequest

        protected ErrorResolver.JsonError handleJsonNodeRequest(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode node,
                                                        java.io.OutputStream output)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the given JsonNode and writes the responses to the given OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        node - the JsonNode
        output - the OutputStream
        Returns:
        the error code, or 0 if none
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error

      • getServiceName

        protected java.lang.String getServiceName(java.lang.String methodName)
        Get the service name from the methodNode. In this class, it is always null. Subclasses may parse the methodNode for service name.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the JsonNode for the method
        Returns:
        the name of the service, or null

      • getMethodName

        protected java.lang.String getMethodName(java.lang.String methodName)
        Get the method name from the methodNode.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the JsonNode for the method
        Returns:
        the name of the method that should be invoked

      • getHandler

        protected java.lang.Object getHandler(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Get the handler (object) that should be invoked to execute the specified RPC method. Used by subclasses to return handlers specific to a service.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - an optional service name
        Returns:
        the handler to invoke the RPC call against

      • setBackwardsCompatible

        public void setBackwardsCompatible(boolean backwardsCompatible)
        Sets whether or not the server should be backwards compatible to JSON-RPC 1.0. This only includes the omission of the jsonrpc property on the request object, not the class hinting.
        Parameters:
        backwardsCompatible - the backwardsCompatible to set

      • setRethrowExceptions

        public void setRethrowExceptions(boolean rethrowExceptions)
        Sets whether or not the server should re-throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        rethrowExceptions - true or false

      • setAllowExtraParams

        public void setAllowExtraParams(boolean allowExtraParams)
        Sets whether or not the server should allow superfluous parameters to method calls.
        Parameters:
        allowExtraParams - true or false

      • setAllowLessParams

        public void setAllowLessParams(boolean allowLessParams)
        Sets whether or not the server should allow less parameters than required to method calls (passing null for missing params).
        Parameters:
        allowLessParams - the allowLessParams to set

      • setErrorResolver

        public void setErrorResolver(ErrorResolver errorResolver)
        Sets the ErrorResolver used for resolving errors. Multiple ErrorResolvers can be used at once by using the MultipleErrorResolver.
        Parameters:
        errorResolver - the errorResolver to set
        See Also:
        MultipleErrorResolver

      • setInvocationListener

        public void setInvocationListener(InvocationListener invocationListener)
        Sets the InvocationListener instance that can be used to provide feedback for capturing method-invocation statistics.
        Parameters:
        invocationListener - is the listener to set

      • setHttpStatusCodeProvider

        public void setHttpStatusCodeProvider(HttpStatusCodeProvider httpStatusCodeProvider)
        Sets the HttpStatusCodeProvider instance to use for HTTP error results.
        Parameters:
        httpStatusCodeProvider - the status code provider to use for translating JSON-RPC error codes into HTTP status messages.

      • setConvertedParameterTransformer

        public void setConvertedParameterTransformer(ConvertedParameterTransformer convertedParameterTransformer)
        Sets the ConvertedParameterTransformer instance that can be used to mutate the deserialized arguments passed to the service method during invocation.
        Parameters:
        convertedParameterTransformer - the transformer to set

      • setShouldLogInvocationErrors

        public void setShouldLogInvocationErrors(boolean shouldLogInvocationErrors)
        If true, then when errors arise in the invocation of JSON-RPC services, the error will be logged together with the underlying stack trace. When false, no error will be logged. An alternative mechanism for logging invocation errors is to employ an implementation of InvocationListener.
        Parameters:
        shouldLogInvocationErrors - see method description
